title: rustdoc: doc_cfg on trait impls needs more visibility

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

body:
I'm trying to annotate all the parts of a crate that are available based on feature flags and I've had the following experience when annotating a trait impl.

```rust
#[cfg(feature = "registry")]
#[cfg_attr(docsrs, doc(cfg(feature = "registry")))]
impl<'a, L, S> LookupSpan<'a> for Layered<L, S>
where
    S: Subscriber + LookupSpan<'a>,
{
    type Data = S::Data;

    fn span_data(&'a self, id: &span::Id) -> Option<Self::Data> {
        self.inner.span_data(id)
    }
}
```

This is what it looks like with the default visibility

![Screenshot from 2020-01-10 11-07-39](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1993852/72179528-f3b59d00-3399-11ea-9ed6-1e6d3456eb9e.png)

After expanding a single [+]

![Screenshot from 2020-01-10 11-07-48](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1993852/72179534-f6b08d80-3399-11ea-8d06-c01061e1c2fa.png)

Fully expanded

![Screenshot from 2020-01-10 11-08-00](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1993852/72179539-f912e780-3399-11ea-95aa-e88ab217a58c.png)

Ideally the default visibility with everything minimized should still indicate that this trait impl is dependent upon the given feature.
